Possibly associate of L M Lefevre. Trading as Kohler & Co (1838-50)

Scarcity of rags c1800 encouraged experimentation with recycling waste paper. Koops associate of Elias Carpenter the inventer of new paper making methods. Published first book printed on straw paper in 1800. Efforts supported by Parliament but bankrupt by 1802
Manufacturing paper from waste, staw, wood etc. Matthias Koops also active at Neckinger Mill
